Articles.Content:
It is the 14th year of Kerbal exploration at the Kerbal Space Program. The brave Kerbals have explored the Mün, Minmus, Eve. and Duna, but something was missing. An asteroid station! Scientists have been debating the thought of using an asteroid as a refueling station for years, but they hadn't really supported the idea that much, due to lack of funds.

However, after the big rise in popularity after the successful landings on Duna, the KSP now has enough funds to attempt the impossible. Capture an asteroid, bring it to LKO, and set up a space station on it. 

Now, unfortunately, due to government concerns, the asteroid capture and redirection footage has not been released as of yet. But, to make up for this, the government has released photographs of the asteroid in orbit and the docking of different modules. They have also released audio recordings from the launches.

OFFICAL GOVERMENT DOCUMENTS. DECLASSIFIED

RADIO RECORDING:

Control: "Jeb, this is Gene Kerman. All systems go, and we have a go for launch. I need a crew report."

Jeb: "Go for launch! Pulse is normal, bpm is good, I am in good spirits!"

Valentina: "I am go Gene! All vital signs normal."

Bob: "Whyyyy????? NOOOOO!!!! I hate space!!!!!"

Control: "Uh, Bob? We need a confirmation. you are the mission doctor, you know."

Bob: "Sorry Gene. I am go. Everything good."

Bill: I am ready! Let's do this!!!"

Gene: "Launch 'em, boys."

 

With a roar of smoke, the rocket lifted off, to rendezvous with the asteroid in LKO. (Remember, this was classified)

 

AUTHORS NOTE:
 

I hope you enjoyed this! More coming soon.

Edited April 13, 2017 by Lo Var Lachland
